comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: "Edmund Schulthess (2 March 1868, Villnachern - 22 April 1944, Bern) was a Swiss politician." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edmund_Schulthess He was a member of the Swiss government (Federal Council) from July 17, 1912 to April 15, 1935 as head of the Department of Economic Affairs. In 1917, 1921, 1928 and 1933 he was President of the Swiss Confederation. This photo is printed in the Bisbee daily review., January 09, 1917, Page 6, "SWISS NEUTRALITY NOT TO BE ALTERED" and the Mexico Missouri message., January 25, 1917, Image 6 "NEW EXECUTIVES OF SWITZERLAND". It's also in The Democratic banner., January 02, 1917, Page 7 under the caption "LEADING NEUTRAL NATIONS PLANNING CONFERENCES ON ENDING THE WAR".
